comment: Online class. Discussion and quiz each week that are graded easily. Take her

I really liked Dr. Taylor for the one lecture she gave. She was incredibly knowledgeable and relayed information in an easy-to-understand way. I was very hopeful for the class! After that first lecture though it was all self-directed learning. I don't recommend her for an online class but I think she would be good in person.

This course was very easy. Many discussions in this class, few outside assignments that involved certain topics they were never difficult. Super easy quizzes and no tests or exams. She was a fair grader and was probably one of the easiest classes ive ever taken. if you want an easy A i would recommend this class if you need it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I took Professor Taylor online. There were no lectures for the class, just discussions, quizzes, and essays. Free online textbook. Test bank quizzes. None of the discussion/essay material is her own. Finished with a 98. Definitely my easiest class of the semester. The only thing is that she takes weeks/months to grade. Take her online if you can.

She is a very nice person. You can tell that she cares about her job and her students. As long as you try, you will pass. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she gives extra credit a lot so going increases your chances. I will be taking a third class with her.

She was an "alright" teacher. Some of her lectures went really fast and didn't really understand anything she talked about since she goes really fast. Tests are pretty easy, a lot of the info on tests are in the book. Have online discussions and a group project at the end. If you read the chapter in the book I wouldn't say you HAVE to go to class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: One of the best professors I ever had! Her syllabus and grading rubric are understandable and clear & she is so funny with her lectures. However, I wouldn't bother buying the book as vocabulary and terms can be found on websites such as Quizlet!

Even though attendance is not mandatory, she does do in class participation which can count as attendance but also towards your grade. She gave many extra credit opportunities. Very nice and respected, will respond to emails and easy to talk to. Definitely would suggest taking her for Sociology.

Prof. Taylor is really caring and friendly. Tests are a lot of vocab so all you really need to study is the review list she puts on D2L. She says we need the textbook but honestly you can def. get by without buying it. It's a lot of self-teaching + weekly participation grade. I only got a B bc I skipped a lot and missed the participation points

She gives a list of vocabulary that will be covered on the test, so it is not hard to do good on the tests or projects. I missed a test day and she let me make up the exam with essay's and I got a 100! Very understanding and wants to see her students succeed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many

comment: She's so charismatic and radiates positivity. The class was large so it took away from the interactions that a smaller class would have (I'm not a lecture type person) but her tests were really straightforward. She cares about everyone voicing their opinion and not feeling judged for asking questions. Fashion on point!

You have three tests and the final in this class. They are all pretty easy so I highly recommend. You only have to do two discussion posts the whole semester and one project at the end. Highly recommend this professor.

If you show up to class, do the reading, and know the key terms she provides for you, you'll pass the exams. The class is large, so it is difficult to do group projects. She does video calls and emails outside of class. Just communicate with her and she will help you. She really cares about her students and you can tell.

Just read and know your vocabulary. Her lectures kinda help but they're more like general discussions and don't really directly cover the reading. Tests aren't hard, and she's understanding. Easy daily grades if you go to class, but she doesn't take attendance. Kinda a do-it-yourself class but she answers questions thoroughly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is a sweet person, but I just did not like her. She lectures the whole time, but I do not think that is her fault. She has a lot to cover. She rambles a lot and talks really fast. She does a lot of group projects which are hard to do because there are so many people in the class. Her tests are pretty easy though. If you read, you'll pass.
